text:
Love it.  It's my regular lunch spot.  My favorites are CYO ahi tuna w/ spice tuna and the beef.  The ahi is fresh and high quality or I wouldn't eat it, I don't like any fish besides ahi.  The beef is super yummy too.  Service is great every time I go.  
I just finished my CYO beef so yummy!
This place is so bomb ! I just had it yesterday n I want some more !! The staff are so nice n very attentive ! FIVE STARS ALL THE WAY !!

Love this place! Having eaten at many of the sushi burrito joints around town, this one is my favorite. The service is always on par and the fish always tastes fresh (and they give you a very good amount of it). Also, when I have ordered online to go , my order has always come out accurate which is what put it above my other well-liked sushi burrito place.  Not sure why it's never busy when I go, but I like not having to wait !

I ordered 50$ worth of food from here and it was the biggest mistake of my life the smell alone was awe full and I love sushi so does my girlfriend but this place is absolutely disgusting I do not recommend.

Not gonna lie I'm not a huge fan of the sushirrito hype. I honestly don't know what's good or bad sushirritos they are all pretty much the same to me. But I was craving some sushi and needed to grab something fast so I decided to give this place a shot. 

I created my own and don't even remember what I got with all the different options I had but it was good! I know I got ahi tuna and it did taste pretty fresh in comparison to some places. 

What I did love about this place was the customer service I received. The employees were super nice and provided me with excellent service! :-) They were very patient with me as I couldn't decide what to get and they took the time to explain everything without making me feel rushed at all.
My go-to spot for an amazing Sushi Burrito! Andrew and Ken helped me out with the selections and the food came out amazing, ask for them, they're the best!

Since opening i've tried countless combinations and their staff was extremely cooperative with my wacky but delicious creations. At Ted's they have a wide variety of fishes and fried foods to choose from ranging from fresh fish to salmon skin and fried tofu. All really fresh and the fried foods are actually crunchy compared to other sushi burrito places. I've been coming at least 3-4 times a week and it never gets boring. definitely recommend the burdock roots!

Being Japanese myself I've been resisting the Sushi Burrito craze but my wife really wanted to try it so we stopped by Ted's.

The restaurant is clean, modern and has a nice vibe. The staff is friendly and informative.

I wanted to keep it simple so I went with the tuna bowl with vegetables and I have to say it was really good. The tuna tasted fresh and I was happy to learn that it was prepared daily and in house.

They have a large selection of traditional Japanese toppings which I didn't expect (I later found out that 'Ted' is Japanese so now it makes sense). I think this combination of the traditional Japanese and Americanized options will keep a wide range of customers happy and coming back.

VERY glad I came here, will be back. Try it out!

Decided to try this place after reading reviews on Yelp. Ordered the Chicken Oishi bowl and Shrimp Tempura with Salmon burrito to go. The staff was friendly and helpful with recommendations after I told them it was my first visit. Food was okay but no different from other poke places that are pretty much on every corner of Rainbow Blvd. When I looked at my receipt, realized that a kids teriyaki bowl was charged to me by mistake. So much for the 10% discount for checking in on Yelp... I called them to inquire about the error and the staff who rang up my check couldn't remember helping earlier. Asked if I could get a refund or credit and was told to go back to the store for a refund. I wasn't going to drive all the way back for a mistake they made. Eventually was told to ask for the same person on my next visit and they'll give me a free item. My suggestion is to read back the order to the customer before charging to prevent this inconvenience.

I just tried this place for the first time and am so happy I did. Everything was fresh and delicious, sushi bowls are a yes! A big perk is that a sushi bowl will really fill you up, if I spent the same amount for nigiri or a roll somewhere else I would leave hungry- this place is affordable and I had leftovers. This reminds me of like a subway concept but for sushi with all the toppings to choose from- I love this place!!!

Once you walk in, you are welcomed by a friendly staff and they engage in conversation with you about their menu. This is perfect for first timers like me. This place just opened recently and the food is fresh and tasty. One of my favorite things to eat are pickled vegetables and this place has one of the best pickled carrots I have ever tasted. It's sweet, crunchy, and with the taste of sour vinegar. It's not too pungent, it's just perfect. I definitely would recommend getting your meal in a bowl, since this place is new, they haven't quite mastered rolling techniques because their burritos still fall apart and there is too much sauce on some parts of the burrito then the other. This place was quite pleasant, I will most likely come again to eat instead of the usual Zen and Soyo.

I walked in by accident and l was hungry...

Sushi served like subway.  The wasabi sauce is incredibly delicious.

They do it right in front of you.  Pretty impressive.

Try it, you will like this place.

Fish was fresh and delicious. Workers were incredibly friendly and helpful. I got a #1 added soft shell crab and spicy mayo. So good. Small spot but great food and Spruce service. I'll be back no doubt.

Sushi is a traditional Japanese food combining seasoned rice with fish, vegetables, or egg. Sushi burritos are an oversized, modern take on the cuisine. Oddly, Ted's is the only place I've yet found that manages to give sushi burritos a clean, traditional flavor.

The menu suggests a handful of prepared combos with recommended toppings and sauces- the Sashimi Oishi, Tuna Tuna, and Ted's California, listed in order of preference, have been pretty good. I like that they have more traditional toppings available, including two different types of radishes and (my personal favorite!) carrot. The sauces are lighter here than elsewhere, and though some complain of a bland flavor, the profile at Ted's is distinctly different from the overly-sauced mayo-based stuff found at other local chains- and I like it that way.

Staff are friendly and fun, and there are sides to pair with your 'rrito  from traditional (miso soup, seaweed salad, edamame, udon) to fun (imported ramen chips, Hawaiian onion chips, mochi). Note that they are closed on Sundays, so plan date night ahead of time.

TIP: Hurry in to take advantage of their grand opening buy one get one half off promo through the end of October.
I ordered this through Postmates not expecting much, but to my surprise it was great! I got the tofu one with a few customizations and it was super delicious.

Amazing food and friendly service! Everything was fresh and made to order aka heated up after ordering. 
Met the owners and they are great people. Asked for my feedback. So sweet!
Can't wait to come back!

Great service & really fresh food. I've tried other sushi burritos & really liked Ted's! We tried the #1 with fresh ahi, yellowtail & salmon (super fresh & tasty) and the #2 with eel & crab (bbq eel sauce was too tangy but still good). We also tried the special roll of salmon skin & crab (not my favorite as salmon skin was super chewy & soggy) but our favorite was a create your own with spicy tuna & shrimp tempura. The staff made great suggestions & let you know about add ins. It was about $10/burrito and that's pretty standard. Burritos are definitely bigger than several others we've tried and one each was more than enough! We will be back!

This place is great. Had a bowl with fried chicken. All fresh ingredients, employees are helpful, and friendly. Price is good.

I have 0 bad things to say about Ted's, will definitely be back.

I love Ted's! I've been there a handful of times and I always leave happy! I try to get something different every time I go and everything I've gotten so far is delicious! The best part about Ted's is there are so many options to put in your burrito (like subway) that sometimes I'm not too sure what would taste best. I like to ask the person making my burrito what they suggest and they always have suggestions and reasons why that particular suggestion is a good choice.
The people are so nice and informative! Thanks for the great food and experience, guys!

So me and my girlfriend were on our way to Jenni Pho and across the parking lot next to zen express, I immediately see the words "sushi burrito". As soon as we walk in the door we were greeted, which is awesome, I love customer service. 
I did not expect the inside to be modern and set up nicely since it was a new sushi burrito joint that I never heard of. Also the wall in the dining area was decorated with neat drawing instructions on how to order and above the workers station/cashier was a nice 3 screen menu. As you can tell the owner had this nicely planned out and put a lot of money into this business. The male worker recommended the most popular ones, (we ordered the #1 which is the sashimi oishi priced at $10.95) he was very polite and was open to any questions. 
My girlfriend got hers as the bowl and I got mine as a burrito. So just to break it down the burrito

Size: Decently sized burrito compared to others

Taste: delicious, sashimi was fresh and the rice was not to sticky or dry. 

Price: $10.95 which isn't bad since that's what everyone in town pretty much charges

As for the bowl it was a generous size, although they made a mistake and gave my girlfriend a very vinegary rice, which they brought up to her as they found out themselves they made a vinegary rice batch. They offered to redo her bowl for her which was nice. 

The only thing I don't really like about this place is that they need a fountain drink machine, it bugs me when restaurants have only canned soda options. Also they might need some type of Japanese sweet desserts or pastries to finish off after a meal.

Overall I would most likely come back to this place if I am in need of a sushi fix.
Great options, variety, and pricing!! Very friendly staff. Also, the fish tastes very fresh. Highly recommend
Didn't want to backtrack through traffic on my way home from work and found this place on yelp. Fish was very fresh tasting and good quantities. Would definitely go back again!

So on the never ending poke bowl tour. It is just about ridiculous every month see or hear of another poke/burrito restaurant opened in Vegas. Sucker for poke and figure never have enough options in life or poke action. 

Ted's Sushi Burrito works basically like every other poke bowl or burrito option. You start with the base either white or brown rice. Furikake as option on top of the rice. One of the first places went never had that but know that automatic every poke bowl place been to. They do ask first just in case not fan of it. I would highly recommend it! The protein on top get your choice of few options and amount. The toppings is the thing that usually stands out from one spot to another. The more places check out it becoming very similar edamame, mixed greens, raw vegetables (usually carrots, cucumbers, or couple other ones), and seaweed salad. Just some of the ones I notice or remember. The sauces that one thing YOU can count on being different. I find it sometimes much with so many options. I am more traditional poke guy either spicy with mayo base or shoyu base sauce. If the poke is fresh. The whole point poke bowl the fish should stand out by itself. They do have some set bowls that can choose from also on the menu.

I decided make my own bowl. I got two protein spicy salmon and spicy tuna. I think the spicy salmon was on the special board. They do have special board as soon as you walk in. It decent size chalkboard so make sure check it out before order. The spicy salmon not that much fan. It tasted bland, salmon not taste that fresh, and not spicy or tiny kick in it. The spicy tuna was complete opposite. I like everything about it. The tuna tasted fresh, nice little kick, and solid spicy tuna. The toppings went with edamame, greens, carrots, and seaweed salad. All the topping were fresh and filled out the bowl perfect. The portion size is good size and like most poke bowl reasonable price. 

One thing that earned star all by itself! I notice they had place of individual wrap spam musubi. Love spam musubi!!! Outside of local restaurant not many places that sell random spam musubi. None of the other poke bowl spot I have been to so far sell them. It was good. The perfect compliment for any food. I know local in me. 

The interior enjoy. On one side has this whole artwork with the concept of poke bowl or sushi burrito. Lot of space sit down. The staff is super friendly, positive, and while there had great conversation with one of the workers. Just talking food and life. Chill atmosphere dine in. Overall say another solid poke bowl spot in town.

Love this place so much . The quality of the fishes are amazing . All the ingredients are very fresh 
 The employees are amazing as well . Really recommend.

I give them props - out of all the many poke / sushi burrito places that are poppin' up around town, they are truly memorable, and clean!!! Ordered my own sushi burrito bowl, basically ordered brown rice, my protein ( crab + paid extra for salmon protein), fresh toppings, and sauces. It is like the Chipotle line type of service. I also took a look at Ted's favorites, definitely something to look at when you're unsure of what to get. I have to say staff was super helpful, and nice. They get a thumps up!!! Couldn't see the board since I forgot my glasses, they do have a menu on their website, they're in the works for a paper one soon. Sauces were legit! I tried their poke wasabi, very tasty and unique. Only paid $10-$11 for my bowl which is a deal! Felt satisfied post meal, went to another sushi burrito spot and still felt hungry. A+
Went today and got the tempura shrimp and salmon burrito it was soooo good as the food always is!!!!

I ordered a DIY bowl through postmates. The bowl was delightful and the portions were satisfying. The only thing I didn't like was the size of the onions. It would've been nice if the onions were sliced thin or in small cubes. Large raw onions... that's a no no.

With a handful of new sushi burrito places in my neighborhood I decided to give Teds a try especially with the great grand opening special they are currently having. Buy 1 get 1 half off for the month of October. Good deal in my book. I ordered a create your own spicy tuna burrito and my husband ordered the  sashimi oishi bowl. All for a whopping $16 with the discount. The poke tasted great, the toppings were fresh and the different sauces were flavorful. The restaurant, although small, was very clean and service was on point. While enjoying our meal the servers brought out a small side of house appetizer which was pickled cucumbers and carrots which was a nice little touch. I will definitely be returning to Teds to try their other amazing menu items!

Hands down THE BEST in the area! The fish is always very fresh and properly contained.  The portions are extremely generous. Not to mention the staff is dynamite. I would recommend Ted's to anyone around.

I think of all the sushi-burrito places that have opened around this area, Ted's is my favorite so far. They give pretty big portions and offer a nice variety of ways for your meal: bowl, burrito, or bento. The bento option is pretty cool, and not many other places offer that. It's very clean indoors and was amazing on its own. The staff is super friendly and recommended a few toppings to add to my burrito, which was really useful because I normally randomly add toppings. I'll definitely be coming back here whenever I want a sushi burrito, poke bowl, or bento box!

Never had a sushi burrito for so Teds was my first!

I did a custom burrito with tuna, spicy crab, garlic ponzu, and avocado in seaweed. So good! I'm glad I asked for a side of spicy mayo because that with soy sauce made this burrito AMAZING!

Will definitely return due to great food quality and SUPER FRIENDLY service. And it's a much healthier quick alternative for dinner over all of the other fast food joints around.

Thanks Ted's!!!

I wanted to like this place, it's convenient and was available on for delivery on postmates late. I attached photos of what I ordered from Ted's on postmates and what I received, but overall it was a disappointment. The fish was fresh, but it was a very small amount and some of the toppings i ordered weren't included in my order. The pictures on Yelp seem deceiving to me, but maybe it's because I ordered through postmates?
Love this place!!! Everything is very fresh and the staff is always so nice. Best sushi/burrito bowl in the area.
I absolutely love this place! Due to their customer service and the food! I got the number 3 w/ yum yum sauce and let me tell u, u will never regret coming here.

This is my first time at this place. I came in for lunch. The guy behind the counter was awesome. He explained how the whole set up works. It is like ordering at  a Subway or Chipotle. The food was great. I had a double scoop of ahi tuna and I love it. No more worries of being stuck with items on your food that you don't want. Here, you can put whichever item you like, as well as the sauces and spice. The prices are reasonable. I'll definitely come back.

This is one of my favorite sushi burrito spots.  Burritos are big and fresh.  Tons of options to choose from.  What really sets it apart from all the other sushi burrito spots in this area is the service.  Everyone is always friendly and helpful.  Employees actually seem like they like their job and are happy to be there.  I've had Ted's a few times now.  Twice for dine in and once delivered by UberEats.  It was better when I dined in.  Maybe not the best to order for delivery.

Such a cute, sanitize, yummy place! The Spam Musubi was kinda pricey though, for $2.50 or something you only get one, meanwhile at L.L you can get 2 for 2, other than that it was a pretty cool stop and near my neighborhood for future trips!

One of the many sushi burrito spots in the southwest on Rainbow Blvd. Their selection isn't as vast as others, but the quality seemed better than average. Tuna didn't have sinew running through the meat like the scraps that some of their competitors use. I got a regular, build your own bowl with ahi tuna, yellowtail, brown rice, garlic ponzu, yuzu ponzu, cucumbers, red onions, cilantro, furikake, and ikura. Not bad, although I'm not a fan of the julienned cuts of cucumbers. I would have preferred smaller pieces. 

They do offer more cooked items like beef sukiyaki, chicken karaage, soft shell cab, and grilled chicken available for burritos.

This is a cool little place to grab something quick and delicious.  You basically just build your own burrito.  The people are extra friendly, especially Tan (sp?) the manager.  

They have option #7 Vegan Panko Tofu which is so damn good!  Those Hawaiian BBQ chips went well with the burrito too! The veggies are pickled without an overwhelming taste of vinegar.  They may even have alcohol in the near future if you need to get your drink on!

Two words Don't bother. 

Ted's is bland tasteless food. I asked for easy rice and still got a large handful on my burrito, it was also dry AF maybe they forgot to add sauce then asked if I wanted fresh or packaged ginger on the side I of course opted for the fresh which turned out to be the pink pickled variety which in my opinion is HORRIBLE. 

The best part of the meal was the Hawaiian chips.
I honestly think this is one of the best sushi burrito places in town. I always get a burrito and the udon and it never fails.

With all the sushi burritos open in this area and good reviews about this place I have high expectations about but the results doesn't turn out the way I looking for. The burrito is so dry and no flavor is like they forgot to put any sauce in it. The only good thing is fish is good and fresh. I might give this place another try but I guess I have to try the another competition in this area so I can compare.

Great service and great food!  

My husband stopped in to get a sushi burrito and even though I had dinner in the car with me all ready, I couldn't resist going down to see what options they had.   Of course I walked out with my own burrito and am I glad I got to try it out also!  

The staff was very friendly and informative.  They helped us construct the right burritos for our tastes.

We took our food to go and once I was a few bites in, I could not stop raving about how good it was!  I ordered the number 3 and it was just bursting with flavor!

We will definitely be frequenting this place!

Don't forget the wasabi if you get it Togo!

Out of all the sushi burrito places I've been to, this is my go to. The employees don't slop together a burrito like some other places, they actually take their time. The beef is delicious and the fish fresh. They have great customer service. I dined in and they gave me a free cucumber salad. And even came back to ask me if I needed anything.
10/10 would recommend

My favorite place for both poke bowls and burritos! There's something about this place that I just love more than others. Prices are reasonable and the associates are fun to chat with. I got a bowl with 3 sides of protein, and a couple other sides - all for $12. So worth it! 

This has been my second visit and I can't wait to come back again.
This place is our new favorite!  I created a custom burrito and it was awesome. The fish was super fresh and the customer service was excellent!

I've had sushi burritos before and I have to say that I really enjoyed this one.

I got Ted's Unagi which is $8.95. I had it with spicy crab salad, cucumber, tobiko, eel sauce, and seaweed salad. It's $0.60 extra for each toppings so my total was $10.15.

Putting the seaweed salad made for a different experience. It was an overwhelming addition that I couldn't taste the eel at all. It was as if I should've never had the eel or never added the seaweed. The burrito was still good though. I really liked it. 

The venue is really nice and clean. It's small but there are tables and seats for people to eat in. The employees were really friendly. I would recommend this place. I would come back again to try other burritos or make my own.

Such friendly staff and delicious food. Me and two others decided to end our day here and I have to say I was more than please. My brothers fish was incredibly fresh and they accommodated for vegan and vegetarian diets too. A great place for a quick bite or a date! 

There was more food than we could finish, and it was all delicious. The ambience is casual but very hip. This might be my new favorite place

My friend suggested checking this place out since they had vegan options for us. I'm glad she did because I think it was the best sushi burrito I've ever had. From the minute we walked in, they were so nice & welcoming. 

My friend & I ordered the #7 Vegan Panko Tofu & it was so freaking good! It was so flavorful. I should have ordered 2 burritos. My older boys ordered #5's shrimp & salmon & loved their burritos as well. 
 
They have a rewards program, yesssss!!! We are definitely coming back!

This place is delicious!!! It's the same owner as curry Zen, which happened to be next door. The sushi "burrito" is basically a large sushi roll, that is very customizable. The fish is fresh and they have about 40 or more options of things to put in it. Totally worth the price too!!
This place is always on point.  Great burritos and decent prices.  Their loyalty program is awesome as well.  I love this place.

Never having had a sushi burrito before, but wanting to try it, I decided to try Ted's. Why? Convenience, good reviews, and hell...it's called TED'S! LOL

Hailing from Boston and being REALLY picky about my fish, I've been super hesitant to eat seafood in here Vegas, as the majority is frozen (ewwww), and the locals opinions as to what's good is rather....subjective...lol (I've been here two years, and STILL barely eat any...*sigh*) 

 After looking dubiously at the setup (nothing wrong with it, just not what I had envisioned) and asking some questions, I still asked to taste a few things, which they were happy to let me do. 

I have to say, I was very pleasantly surprised...it was all very fresh, and not at ALL fishy! They even told me up front about some items that are frozen, so I didn't order anything I might be disappointed with.  I wound up getting a custom made soy wrap with spicy tuna and spicy salmon, cucumber, radish, pickled ginger, a bit of cilantro, red roe, tempura crunch, sesame oil and wasabi mayo. Damn that was tasty!  

Prices are very reasonable anyway, but If you check in on Yelp, you'll get a first time ten percent discount (yay for discounts!) They also do a frequent buyer program through FiveStars, and you can get free food with your points (super yay for free food!!)  You can have delivery done by any of the major food delivery services as well. 

I'm hoping they'll expand that menu a bit more, and also that though tamago IS a protein, that the add-on cost won't continue to be as much as it is for extra fish.  These are the reasons I didn't give five stars, but if I could have done 4.5, I would have. 
Regardless, I'll be making return trips here for sure, and I'm glad to have found it.  :-)

For the price that I paid for, this burrito filled me up to the point of sweet euphoric salmon joy. They give a lot of fish, and a lot of sides and toppings. What a splendid day and a great way to end it. All poetry and all bows to this place. Once you befriend Ted, there's no going back...to jaburrito...or soho.... but I'm not pointing fingers.
Thank you to the staff that worked tonight because they were super and beautifully knowledgeable in what we all wanted and how we loved fish. 
Yes.
Ted.
So awesome! We don't have this in Texas yet. I mixed grilled salmon with teriyaki chicken and jalapeños. One of the best decisions I've ever made.
Super fresh yummy fish!! The burrito didn't stay well together but I did add lots of stuff! Employees were very helpful and patience with my indecisive self!!

This place is amazing! I placed a pick order and it was ready as soon as I walked in the door, 10 minutes before the time it said it was going to be ready. They don't charge you extra for each individual topping either. The burritos are big and taste awesome! Best sushi burrito I've had!

This place is pretty good. A nice interior design, really helpful and nice staff plus delicious food.

Really, my only gripe, is that it's no different than the other 10 places that sell sushi burritos within a half mile of here. Because the location of this place isn't very prominent, I would highly recommend to this place that they come up with a niche to set themselves apart. Maybe offer a roll no one else is doing. Everyone is doing bowls and burritos. How about a burrito that's "enchilada style" smothered in a spicy mayo with roe or something unique like that?

I love this place! This is by far one of the best sushi burrito joints I've been to. The boyfriend normally doesn't like eating raw fish, but with a menu that has cooked options like salmon and beef he was able to enjoy a sushi burrito for me.

My personal favorite is the ahi tuna burrito, I add salmon skin for that extra crunch. I love the house poke sauce and yum yum sauce the best.

The interior decoration here is modern and simple, service is friendly, and they have a point card system where you can accumulate a free, drink, miso soup and etc. 

Stop by here if you ever get the chance to! It's absolutely delicious!

Ted's Sushi Burrito has a great customer service. Recommend if you know what and how to order. They have a subway ordering style, unless you know what sauce, vegetables and how to mix your order this place is for you!!!
This place is amazing. I went the first time yesterday and had to go back today. The staff is super friendly and the food is fresh and delicious. 10/10 would recommend

I heard this spot was pretty new so I decided to check it out. I tried the #5 which was shrimp tempura and salmon. it was sooo good. I probably could've had another burrito haha and to top everything off the customer service was amazing. I didn't get his name but he was helpful when I needed a high chair for my baby. 5 stars!

Since discovering this place, this will be the only place I go for Sushi Burritos (which let's be honest are just giant hand-rolls). The owner is always there. He is a bright young entrepreneur who will be going places. The fish is fresh and the burritos are amazing. I always get a number 1 with extra fish for less than $2 per extra protein. They have a ton of veggies to customize it if you like. I'm pretty basic on veggies so tofu & cucumber are good enough for me. If you like wasabi, they other two sauces with it including wasabi mayo. You can also ask for wasabi packets on the side for an extra kick. Definitely check it out! Best sushi burritos in town! No doubt!

Clean, fresh food and cool staff.. It's safe to say they're going to probably be the best sushi burrito spot in time. It's not only about the food here but the vibe and prices fit right in to what makes this place special.

If you are a Sushi Burrito lover, this place is the best!!! The portions of protein are bigger then any in town, not too much rice.  Fish is fresh!!  Sides are fresh and crunchy!!!  Super nice staff!!! This place beats all the rest in product!!!  Take it to go!!!  It's not known for the ambiance.  But I'm not going there for that anyway!!! I could only eat half!!!

I really enjoy Ted's Sushi Burrito because of their portion size. They are very generous in their scoops, which is always a plus because a lot of other poké places don't give enough. The layer of surimi crab I get is unreal & the bowl is a big size. I always have leftovers.

I have been to the location once when they opened, but other than that I only order through Postmates because the delivery fee is only $3.99 or free if you have Plus & have a minimum order of $25.

The customer service is great every time I have an issue.

I missed an item in my order & I just wanted a refund on the one item, but they refunded the whole order. Then another time, I was given the wrong order & they refunded me for that, reorder & also refund that so I have my correct food with no charge. I'm not sure if it's Postmates driver's fault or theirs, but I appreciate their willingness to fix the problem.
Solid place with solid workers! Such a clean, cool, and collective place! If you like fresh sushi this is a must visit place!! Great job Ted!
Mediocre food and to add insult to injury the "included" toppings consist of onions, cilantro,cucumber and carrots. Everything else is a premium...no thank you.

try the spicy tuna burrito for $6.95, grab another one for half price on their grand opening promotion, taste basically the same as other places popping up all over... difference in here is they have udon, fried chicken and beef teriyaki for those don't like raw stuff....

This place makes a delicious sushi burrito, you can taste the fresh, high quality ingredients in every bite. The friendly chef that prepares your burrito offers many options and suggestions to either create your own or try one of theirs. 

My only gripe is they're not open late late night. 

Best sushi burrito in town so far.

Never had a sushi burrito till now... and I have to say it is everything I hoped it would be!  Tuna tuna was very tasty and the salmon and shrimp was great as well.  I'm knocking down a star for the lack of spam musubi I was craving though.

We ordered 3 completely different burritos,  customized to our tastes.  Everything was fresh and clean and looked delicious.  The customer service was spectacular.  We asked for recommendations for each roll and they did not disappoint. Everything we got was delicious.  3 burritos for 2 people is too much,  but we wanted variety and honestly the prices are so great,  it was worth it.  We will be eating the leftovers for lunch tomorrow and we will definitely go back for another round.

After coming back from Hawaii, I was craving some fresh poke so I decided to give this place a try. I ordered the bowl with salmon and ahi with mixed greens and it was DELICIOUS! The server suggested the shoyu sauce and it was perfect! The salmon and ahi were really fresh :) Servers were great! Definitely will be going back more often since it's conveniently located near me :)

Tried this place out since it was close by and had late hours. I've only had this new sushi burrito thing once before and it was decent. I like the idea of being able to instantly fulfill a sushi craving on the go without having to sit down with chopsticks at a bar or table. So I was immediately drawn to this concept. 

The first place I tried was okay but nothing memorable. So glad I gave Teds a try. I had the #2 Ted's Unagi... I was a bit puzzled about what toppings to add but ending up adding seaweed salad, cucumbers and ginger to the spicy crab and BBQ eel. It was so delish I wished I ordered another.  Service was a bit slow because there were so many in person and online orders ahead of me but they were playing good tunes over the soundsystem (90s Hip-hop and R&B) while I waited so that was enjoyable. 

The thing is...I know I'll be an obsessive regular now because I love sushi so much especially on hot days. And we have quite a few of those in Las Vegas.  I can't wait to bring out of town guests to try out this local phenomenon--sushi burritos-- but only at Ted's!
First time trying this place and I will definitely be back. Anthony was so helpful! Cyo burrito was amazing and the chicken teriyaki bowl was juicy and delicious! I'll become a regular really soon!

This is my second time given this place a try & I can say that the second time is better than the first. The first time the food was underwhelming & I contemplated ordering it tonight. However, hubby went out with the boys for dinner, so why not? I ordered from postmates again. I caught that they had a udon noodle soup thing and that's what sold me this time. I also ordered the musubi and it was decent, but not something I would order again. I REALY REALLY wanted to like the Udon noodle soup, but an unpleasant taste & texture to the soup rendered it inedible. There was a burnt flavor that lingered in the broth & when i went to eat a noodle, there was burnt Saran Wrap in my soup. That's the burnt taste that I couldn't shake. I took it out of my soup & began digging around and found another huge piece of plastic. I was super sad. The burrito, ON POINT! The fish was FANTASTIC. I am a small woman and I ate the whole thing. I'll try them again, just not the soup.

The food is excellent! I got a #1 along with udon noodles. The food tasted excellent with quality and freshness you could taste. Their variety of toppings and customization options also made my order even better fit to my taste. Excellent customer service as well! Employees were attentive and accommodating. I could tell they truly cared about my dining experience, which was honestly refreshing as other places don't really care. The atmosphere and environment of the place were also great! This place is super clean and well decorated. I will definitely be dining here again soon!! 10/10

I tried this place because it was one of the options on PostMates. Although I've never actually been to the location, everything was fresh and they gave you so much in a sushi burrito. They even put all my sauces on the side. I will definitely be coming back for more!

The quality of the food wasn't worth the price I paid for the bowl I got. A lot of their items looked like they were past the last days they are supposed to be used. So honestly lacking in quality and quantity
Pretty good! Very fresh, and great customer service. A bit pricey though, I wish the portion sizes would be a bit bigger!

Omg! Is all I have to say! Along with Nom-Nom-Nom! I've been wanting to try this place out since they opened. The burrito itself is pretty big. I made my own burrito. Spicy tuna,ahi tuna,shrimp tempura,jalapeños,cucumbers,avocado,cream cheese,yum yum sauce and house poke sauce wrapped in seaweed!!!! They give good size portions of protein. I couldn't finish by myself so my brother in law ate half.  I was stuffed on half of a burrito. All I have to say is I can't wait to come back and try something new the next time.

This newest sushi style.
They are using fresh fish,so good.
Their cooked items, like eel and tempura, are very delicious as well.
The in house unagi sauce had plenty of flavor and not overly sweet.
I enjoyed having endless vegetables to choose for my burrito.
The service was very friendly and the staff helped me through the whole process.
I can't wait to come back.

Probably one of the best sushi burrito places around. Their fish is fresh compared to other chain sushi burrito places and the prices are reasonable. A bowl/bento is better priced here if you do the math compared to its competition. They also offer beef sukiyaki which every other place lacks.

In the explosion  of sushi burrito and poke places in Vegas, this one is a bit different. I am not reallly a seafood person, while my other half is, so trying to find an place that we both like can be a challenge when on it comes to a sushi burrito options. Most of the local burrito and poke places have chicken available for the wrap or bowl, but Ted's has beef, chicken and fried chicken. We have had a couple of the house suggested seafood wraps and make your own wraps with seafood and with chicken/beef. No really bad choices here so far with what we have had. Also, their add-ons like, egg omelet or cream cheese are only 60 cents each while other places charge a lot more. We are going to be regulars.

Just had my BYOB and it was very tasty! For the burrito and drink it was reasonable price! The lady that helped me, Nicole was very very nice. We talked about how the community is growing. Try it out!

I brought my family in Teds about 7pm, and all the food/seafood looked like it had been sitting there for the whole day if not longer, why wouldn't they bring out fresh fish (like every hr) atleast that way it would atleast look presentable. The tuna was brown, the other fish was discolored as well. My kids wanted to try it, since there is so much hype about these sushi burritos, so we did. And I can for sure promise you it was not worth the $45 to fed 2 adults and 2 kids. We could of just went to a sushi bar

yessss. finally this place opened. gatta hand it to them for making a bomb sushi burrito! go with the ted's favorite Tuna Tuna. was amazing. shoyu sesame sauce?? 
anyway fresh tuna, good prices, friendly staff, restaurant is clean and decent portion size. definitely going to come back and try the sushi bowl and update review.

One of the better sushi burritos in town since the inception of the great original Jaburritos now Soho Sushi Burrito/Soho Sushi Bowlrrito. So far, these are the only 2 great sushi burritos in town as far as I am concern.

10/10 would eat again. Sushiburrito more like awesome burrito. These burrito give me life and happiness. The workers are so friendly. The products are so fresh and so clean. They taste tasty and make their own sauces. 

Visit them, you won't regret it

Just ordered myself a bowl here. For protein, I asked for salmon and they gave me just one small scoop of it. So I asked if that was it, and she said yes. So I ended up ordering another scoop of crab meat salad for extra 65 cents. (I know most other sushi bowl places give 2-3 scoops of protein per order...) other than that, it was ok. And they charged me 65cents for seaweed salad topping. Their yuzu ponzu sauce is decent. So overall, taste is decent. But I just wish they'd give a little more protein when they are charging me almost $10 for this bowl...

This was my first time eating at Ted's sushi burrito and it didn't disappoint! I ordered a custom bowl with spicy tuna and yellowtail. The portions of fish were very generous. The sushi rice was sticky and filling and the toppings were plentiful to choose from. I found this place on Yelp and because I checked in as a first time customer, I got a 10% off coupon! The prices are very reasonable. I will definitely be back!
Bomb AF. The staff was super friendly and the food was delicious and very fresh. Highly recommend this place!

I've been on a sushi burrito / poke bowl tasting tour in Las Vegas! So many have opened up & I'm on a mission to try them all! Haha I was excited to try this place because of the great reviews. The service was great. The staff was nice and informative however, the sushi burrito itself wasn't. I had soft shell crab & raw salmon in my burrito and they both tasted very fishy which turned me off immediately. I also couldn't taste any of the sauces I had put on my burrito. I even asked for extra sauce but the fishy taste overpowered it. The burrito was also breaking apart on me while I was eating it. I wish I could give this place more stars because of the great service but unfortunately the food fell short.
Super good, fish taste super fresh , I my opinion it's better than Soho I think Soho is great.

By far my favorite spot to eat in Las Vegas! Not only does Ted's offer the highest quality food, but it also offers the highest quality service as well! Thanh was AMAZING and answered every question I had. He is amazing! If I were Ted, I'd definitely give this fine gentleman a raise! By far the best sushi burrito restaurant in town! If you go, this man will go above and beyond to ensure great customer service!

Great place!

We stumbled upon this place by accident and I'm glad I did. I'm a total newbie so after staring at the menu struggling with my choice, I found asking the staff what are the favs the best way to go. I got the #1 with seaweed wrap and the # 8 with soy wrap. If you seek the sushi experience go with the seaweed. The size of the burrito was nice too.

I enjoyed the flavors a lot. I really liked the boat they provide to customize my wasabi and soy sauce dip. Also the little ginger packet was a nice touch. The water station is a blessing. 

The rewards program they offer is good too. I don't see myself spending this much on weeknight dinners a lot so any little bit helps. I'd go back, the rewards help out. 

Try it. = )

Probably one of the best sushi burrito places I've been in town! I have a gluten allergy and they were extremely helpful with telling me what I can and cannot have. Love their set up and especially love that they have all the fish and condiments refrigerated rather than on ice. Clean storefront, and quality service!

This is my go to spot for lunch at least once a week. I have never had any complaints till recently over the past couple months I've noticed big changes from them taking down the tint off the windows to putting up these horrible tacky curtains the new manager has done something to the ambiance there that I just can't get over changes in ppl there and they way she talk to her coworkers and her short responses to ppl, food is still amazing but even that has changed also in just they way it's made. Andrew and Steve if u r out there it's not the same with out you there you guys were amazing and really made that place!!!!

I've been seeing all these sushi burrito places popping up around town, but never had any interest in trying it out, until recently. One night the husband and I were eating dinner at Zen Curry Express next door. I love that place, but was unhappy that they were out of brown rice that night. As we were leaving, we saw Ted's Sushi Burrito next door and browsed their menu outside. We looked at each other and said "We should have just ate here!" 

So we came back the next night to try this place out. Sushi burritos are basically bigger sushi rice rolls packed with protein and veggies, which sort of look like burritos. The employees here were friendly and made good recommendations after finding out that it was our first time here. You can either create your own burrito, bowl or bento box, or you can choose one of Ted's Favorites, which are also customizable and great for me since I don't like things like onions and radish. I got the #8 - Ted's California as a burrito. Had all of their suggested toppings, except for the radish and added Yum Yum sauce as suggested by one of the employees. I know California rolls are everywhere, but this sushi burrito was very tasty and filling. I think the sauces made the whole thing delicious as well! My husband tried the #1 Sashimi Oishi and the #4 Chicken Karaage and enjoyed both. Okay, so it's not as awesome as getting sushi at an authentic Japanese restaurant, but this is a great alternative when you can't spend so much for great sushi all the time. The ingredients are fresh and they don't make the food until you order it. 

Will definitely be returning in the future. One of the things I really miss from back home in Hawaii is take out sushi places. This is a great option for dinner or for taking lunch to work. They also have a reward program through the FiveStars app - punch in your phone # as you are paying, and you get one point for every dollar spent here. You can later redeem your points for stuff like free seaweed salad, can of soda and 20% off your order. Give this place a try, they are the same owners as Zen Curry!

I came here today to see if this place would be better than any other sushi burrito places around town. When I first entered I was greeted by the workers and asked if it was my first time. I told the guy who was helping me it was my first time. I think his name was Steve. 

He explained their menu to me very well and told me that the burritos wee the most popular. He gave me recommendations which I did consider and went with a few things he recommended. 

I did go for a burrito instead of a bowl or Bento box. I chose soy paper and choose salmon and ahi tuna as my protein. He suggested to go with a wasabi poke sauce and garlic ponzu. I also went with his suggestion on the veggies of cucumbers, green onions, cilantro, and added sweet egg (tamago). I didn't see other options such as crunchy wonton chips so decided on just those to fill the burrito. 

My total came out to $10 and I tipped him for all of his suggestions. The burrito was not anything special and a bit on the higher price point for me since I'm used to going to other places and getting way more options to choose from to add into my burrito or other options of burrito choices. The cucumber was cut thicker than I like so it felt like I was biting into a big piece of carrot every time I took a bite of the burrito. I couldn't taste the wasabi ponzu that much so it wasn't spicy for me and I added soysauce to it while I ate it. 

Overall, the burrito was okay , but maybe in the future I'll come back to try one of their bowls or Bento boxes
